G4519-d-03-09-99-WC.Narrative: WC'S TRAIN-T040 - WAS SHOVING WEST WITH 2 LOCOMOTIVES, 17 LOADS AND 21 EMPTIES ON TRACK 7 IN SCHILLER PARK.  THE CONDUCTOR WAS RIDING THE SHOVE WHEN THEY SHOVED OVER THE 6-7 SWITCH.  THE CONDUCTOR THOUGHT THE SWITCH WAS LINED FOR HIS MOVEMENT THOUGHT HE WAS UNABLE TO SEE THE SWITCH TARGET DUE TO SNOW AROUND THE SWITCH.  THE CONDUCTOR THEN GOT OFF THE CAR, STOPPED THE TRAIN AND TOLD THE ENGINEER TOPULL AHEAD EAST.  AS THE ENGINEER BEGAN TO PULL AHEAD,  THE CONDUCTOR STARTED TO WALK TOWARDS THE ENGINES.  THE TRAIN PULLED EASILY AT FIRST, THEN HARD AND THEN THE ENGINEER STOPPED HIS MOVEMENT.  THE CREW THEN FOUND 6 CARS NEAR THE MIDDLE OF THE THEIR TRAIN DERAILED.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE 6-7 SWITCH HAD NOT BEEN PROPERLY LINED FOR THIS TRAIN'S FIRST MOVEMENT.  THE CREWRAN THROUGH THE SWITCH AND THEN PULLED THEIR TRAIN BACK THROUGH IT WHICH CAUSED THE 6 CARS TO DERAIL.  BOTH CREW MEMBERS WERE TESTED AFTER THE INCIDENT AND ALL TEST RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4517-d-03-09-99-WC.Accident Cause: Speed, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
G4517-d-03-09-99-WC.Narrative: ON 3/9/99, A WC SIGNAL MAINTAINER HAD STOPPED HIS HYRAIL TRUCK, #0360 ON MAINLINE TRACK AT SOLON SPRINGS.  THE MAINTAINER HAD GOTTEN OUT OF HIS TRUCK TO DO SOME REPAIR / MAINTENANCE WORK AT THE SOLARBUNGALOW AT MILEPOST 426.6.  AS THE MAINTAINER BEGAN HIS WORK IN THE BUNGALOW, HE HEARD ANOTHER SIGNAL TECHNICIAN ON THE RADIO STATE HE COULDN'T STOP.  THIS TECHNICIAN WAS OPERATING BOOMTRUCK#8921 ATAPPROX. 10 MPH EASTWARD ON THE SAME MAIN LINE TRACK.  WHEN THE MAINTAINER HEARD THIS, HE RAN OUT OFTHE BUNGALOW AND TO HIS STOPPED TRUCK IN AN ATTEMPT TO MOVE IT BEFORE AN IMPACT OCCURRED.  THE MAINTAINER COULD NOT GET HIS TRUCK GOING AND HAD LEFT HIS DOOR PARTIALLY OPEN WHEN HE WAS STRUCK FROM BEHIND BY THE BOOMTRUCK.  THE MAINTAINER WAS THROWN FROM HIS VEHICLE RESULTING IN INJURIES TO HIS BACKAND HIP.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT REVEALED THAT THE SIGNAL TECHNICIAN THAT WAS OPERATING THEBOOMTRUCK FAILED TO SLOW DOWN FOR THE WEATHER CONDITIONS.  SNOW AND ICE ON THE RAIL CONTRIBUTED TOHIS INABILITY TO STOP BEFORE THE IMPACT.  THE HYRAIL TRUCK SUSTAINED EXTENSIVE DAMAGE WHILE THE BOOMTRUCK HAD MINOR DAMAGE.  THE ONLY INJURY REPORTED WAS TO THE SIGNAL MAINTAINER.  THERE WAS NO TRACKDAMAGE.NoneNone

G4508-d-03-26-99-WC.Narrative: TRAIN, FL088; CONSISTING OF 2 LOCOMOTIVES AT THE HEAD -END AND 1 LOCOMOTIVE AT THE REAR-END, 98 LOADS AND 22 EMPTIES WAS TRAVELING EAST ON MAIN LINE TRACK AT APPROXIMATELY 38 MPH IN KAUKAUNA. TOE103-d-03-20-99-TOE.Narrative: TAMPER OPERATOR WAS RAISING TRACK IN THE MARSHALLING YARD AT VALLIANT, OK.  THE TRANSMISSION CAME LOOSE AND FELL DOWN WHEN REINSTALLING THE TRANSMISSION ON THE BOLT HOLES IN BRACKET WOULD NOT LINE UPWITH THE FRAME.  THE OPERATOR USED A TORCH TO HEAT THE BRACKET AND THE ACCUMULATION OF OIL AND GREASE CAUGHT FIRE AND THE OPERATOR AND HIS HELPER COULD NOT GET IT PUT OUT BEFORE IT DESTROYED THE TAMPER.  THE TAMPER HAD BEEN DEPRECIATED OUT AND DID NOT HAVE A MONETARY VALUE.  AFTER THE INITIAL REPORTWAS COMPLETED, A REEVALUATON AND A DECISION MADE TO REPLACE THE TAMPER AT AN ESTIMATED COST OF $220,000 CAUSING THE INCIDENT TO GO OVER THE REPORTING THRESHOLD.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
